title: Contributing to flir
text: Adding rule exists lintr: Create new .yml file inst new_rule("<rule_name>"), e.g new_rule("expect_length"). Import tests lintr get_tests_from_lintr("<rule_name>"), e.g get_tests_from_lintr("expect_length"). Add "<rule_name>" list linters located R/list-linters.R. Load package devtools::load_all(), run update_linter_factory(). creates new entry R/linters_factory.R. Run devtools::document() register new entry. Tweak .yml file tests pass (cases, lintr tests can commented ). rule comes fix, add additional snapshot tests fix_text(), e.g.
code: test_that("fix works", {   linter <- expect_length_linter()    expect_snapshot(fix_text("expect_equal(length(x), 2L)", linters = linter))   expect_snapshot(fix_text("expect_identical(length(x), 2L)", linters = linter))    expect_snapshot(fix_text("expect_equal(2L, length(x))", linters = linter))   expect_snapshot(fix_text("expect_identical(2L, length(x))", linters = linter)) })

text: use stop(), can pass multiple elements, like paste0(): possible rlang::abort(), needs everything argument message, meaning need manually put elements paste0(): Therefore, can look pattern stop(...) replace rlang::abort(paste0(...)). Capturing elements pattern done $$$ elements can used fix message arguments using wrapping ~~: storing rule flir/rules/custom/stop_abort.yml, can call: Running example lint_text() now shows message: fix_text() correctly applies fix: Note still corner cases address, ignoring arguments call. domain stop() specified, scope vignette.
code: n <- 10 stop("Got ", n, " values instead of 1.") #> Error: Got 10 values instead of 1. n <- 10 rlang::abort(paste0("Got ", n, " values instead of 1.")) #> Error: #> ! Got 10 values instead of 1. id: stop_abort-1 language: r severity: warning rule:   pattern: stop($$$ELEMS) fix: rlang::abort(paste0(~~ELEMS~~)) message: Use `rlang::abort()` instead of `stop()`. flir::lint_text(   'stop("Got ", n, " values instead of 1.")',   linters = "stop_abort" ) flir::lint_text(   'stop("Got ", n, " values instead of 1.")',    linters = "stop_abort" ) #> Original code: stop("Got ", n, " values instead of 1.")  #> Suggestion: Use `rlang::abort()` instead of `stop()`.  #> Rule ID: stop_abort-1 flir::fix_text(   'stop("Got ", n, " values instead of 1.")',   linters = "stop_abort" ) #> Old code: stop("Got ", n, " values instead of 1.") #> New code: rlang::abort(paste0("Got ", n, " values instead of 1."))

title: Find and Fix Lints in R Code
text: Optional setup: setup_flir(): creates folder flir populates built-rules well cache file. can modify rules add new ones want control. can use flir -, without setup. However, running setup_flir() enables use caching, meaning subsequent runs faster. also gives place can store custom rules project/package. everyday usage consists two functions: lint() looks lints R files; fix() looks lints R files automatically applies replacement (). One can also experiment flir::lint_text() flir::fix_text():
code: flir::lint_text(   " any(is.na(x)) any(duplicated(y)) " ) #> Original code: any(is.na(x))  #> Suggestion: anyNA(x) is better than any(is.na(x)).  #> Rule ID: any_na-1  #>  #> Original code: any(duplicated(y))  #> Suggestion: anyDuplicated(x, ...) > 0 is better than any(duplicated(x), ...).  #> Rule ID: any_duplicated-1 flir::fix_text(   " any(is.na(x)) any(duplicated(y)) " ) #> Old code: #> any(is.na(x)) #> any(duplicated(y)) #>  #> New code: #> anyNA(x) #> anyDuplicated(y) > 0

title: Find and Fix Lints in R Code
text: used tool lints detection R lintr. However, lintr’s performance optimal applied medium large packages. Also, lintr perform automatic replacement lints. styler package clean code fixing indentation things, doesn’t perform code replacement based lints. flir quite performant. small benchmark 3.5k lines code linters:
code: file <- system.file("bench/test.R", package = "flir")  bench::mark(   lintr = lintr::lint(     file,     linters = list(       lintr::any_duplicated_linter(),       lintr::any_is_na_linter(),       lintr::matrix_apply_linter(),       lintr::function_return_linter(),       lintr::lengths_linter(),       lintr::T_and_F_symbol_linter(),       lintr::undesirable_function_linter(),       lintr::expect_length_linter()     )   ),   flir = flir::lint(     file,     linters = list(       flir::any_duplicated_linter(),       flir::any_is_na_linter(),       flir::matrix_apply_linter(),       flir::function_return_linter(),       flir::lengths_linter(),       flir::T_and_F_symbol_linter(),       flir::undesirable_function_linter(),       flir::expect_length_linter()     ),     verbose = FALSE,     open = FALSE   ),   check = FALSE ) #> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering #> is disabled. #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec` #>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl> #> 1 lintr         2.97s    2.97s     0.337  315.05MB     2.36 #> 2 flir       180.79ms 181.69ms     5.43     1.85MB     0

code: # `fix_text()` is convenient to explore with a small example fix_text("any(duplicated(rnorm(5)))") #> Old code: any(duplicated(rnorm(5)))  #> New code: anyDuplicated(rnorm(5)) > 0   fix_text("any(duplicated(rnorm(5))) any(is.na(x)) ") #> Old code: #> any(duplicated(rnorm(5))) #> any(is.na(x)) #>  #> New code: #> anyDuplicated(rnorm(5)) > 0 #> anyNA(x)  # Setup for the example with `fix()` destfile <- tempfile() cat(" x = c(1, 2, 3) any(duplicated(x), na.rm = TRUE)  any(duplicated(x))  if (any(is.na(x))) {   TRUE }  any(   duplicated(x) )", file = destfile)  fix(destfile) #> ℹ Going to check 1 file. #> ✔ Fixed 3 lints in 1 file. cat(paste(readLines(destfile), collapse = "\n")) #>  #> x <- c(1, 2, 3) #> anyDuplicated(x) > 0 #>  #> anyDuplicated(x) > 0 #>  #> if (anyNA(x)) { #>   TRUE #> } #>  #> anyDuplicated(x) > 0

title: flir 0.3.0
text: BREAKING: flint renamed flir avoid namespace conflict recent flint package CRAN. Thanks Mikael Jagan warning (#63). Consequences: setup_flint() renamed setup_flir() creates folder named flir instead flint; setup_flint_gha() renamed setup_flir_gha() creates YAML file named flir.yml instead flint.yml; update_flint() renamed update_flir(); ignoring specific lines now requires flir-ignore instead flint-ignore; environment variable FLINT_ERROR_ON_LINT renamed FLIR_ERROR_ON_LINT; flint used package, .Rbuildignore must updated ignore folder flir instead flint.

title: flir 0.2.1
text: New environment variable FLINT_ERROR_ON_LINT determine whether flint error lints found.

title: flir 0.2.1
text: longer error unavailable sourceMarkers running lint() Positron. Better detection flint/config.yml using running flint package directory. cache used setup_flir() now invalidated rules used change. print “empty data.table(…)” lints detected.

title: flir 0.2.0
text: New linter stopifnot_all_linter() detect calls stopifnot((...)) since () unnecessary. automatic fix available. New linter list_comparison_linter() detect comparison list, e.g. lapply(x, sum) > 10. automatic fix available. Line breaks removed multi-line messages reported lint* functions. matrix_apply_linter now detects 1L 2L used MARGIN argument. any_is_na_linter now reports cases like NA %% x, can fix anyNA(x) instead.

title: flir 0.2.0
text: library_call_linter longer reports cases library() calls wrapped suppressPackageStartupMessages(). Nested fixes longer overlap. fix*() functions now run several times files containing nested fixes fixes apply. can deactivated run per file adding rerun = FALSE (#61). any_is_na_linter wrongly reported cases like (.na(x), y). longer reported. longer lint fix expect_equal(length(x), length(y)), readable expect_length(x, length(y)). longer lint fix expect_equal(names(x), names(y)), readable expect_named(x, names(y)).

title: flir 0.1.2
text: sample(n, m) now reported can rewritten sample.int(n, m) n literal integer.

title: flir 0.1.2
text: Rule names harmonized use dash instead underscore, e.g. any_duplicated-1 instead any_duplicated_1. Replacement redundant_ifelse_linter form ifelse(cond, FALSE, TRUE) now works (#57). absolute_path_linter deactivated 0.0.5 still reported. now properly ignored. Code like expect_equal(typeof(x), 'class') modified twice expect_identical_linter expect_type_linter, lead wrong rewrite. now replaced expect_type(x, 'class').

title: flir 0.1.1
text: fix() lint() now work correctly several paths passed. fix_package() lint_package() used R files present root path, even folders typical R package. fix_dir() fix_package() now arguments force verbose, like fix().

title: flir 0.1.0
text: New linters: rep_len_linter(), sample_int_linter() which_grepl_linter(). Add menu error fix() variants change unstaged files. update_flint() now updates rules doesn’t add new rules anymore.

title: flir 0.0.9
text: New linters: condition_message_linter() expect_identical_linter(). Rewrote vignette adding new rules. setup_flir() now puts built-rules flint/rules/builtin.

title: flir 0.0.8
text: New linters: expect_comparison_linter package_hooks_linter. Add argument verbose lint_package() lint_dir(). Better message lints can fixed. Add one case seq_linter seq_len(x) faster seq(1, x). Better handling exclude_path.

title: flir 0.0.7
text: Set Github Actions workflow flint (#22). New linters function_return_linter todo_comment_linter. Better support library_call_linter. Add argument overwrite setup_flir_gha().

title: flir 0.0.6
text: New linter redundant_equals_linter. Better support matrix_apply_linter.
